DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether chronic pulmonary disease is present.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to chronic pulmonary disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disease or condition that persists or progresses over a long period of time.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: No history of pulmonary disease such as emphysema or COPD, (FEV1>= 2L or >=75% of predicted for height and age). Pulmonary function tests (PFTs) are required in patients with significant pulmonary or smoking history.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of pulmonary disease such as emphysema or COPD, (FEV >60% of predicted for height and age required in patients with prolonged smoking history or symptoms or respiratory dysfunction)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of pulmonary disease such as emphysema or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), (FEV1>60% of predicted for height and age).  Pulmonary functions tests (PFTs) are required in patients with prolonged smoking history or symptoms of respiratory dysfunction.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of pulmonary disease such as emphysema or COPD, (FEV1>=2L or >=75% of predicted for height and age required in patients with prolonged smoking history or symptoms or respiratory dysfunction).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of other pulmonary disease such as emphysema or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), (FEV1<60% of predicted for height and age). Pulmonary function tests (PFTs) are required in patients with prolonged smoking history or symptoms of respiratory dysfunction

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: No history of pulmonary disease such as emphysema or COPD, (FEV1>=2L or >=75% of predicted for height and age required in patients with prolonged smoking history or symptoms or respiratory dysfunction).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of pulmonary disease such as emphysema or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) (FEV1<60% of predicted for height and age). Pulmonary function tests (PFTs) are required in patients with prolonged smoking history or symptoms of respiratory dysfunction

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: No history of severe COPD or emphysema or interstitial lung disease currently on home supplemental oxygen. Patients with NSCLC with stable COPD or emphysema not requiring supplemental oxygen are eligible.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient has a history of significant pulmonary disease, prolonged smoking history, or symptoms of respiratory dysfunction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have clinically significant pulmonary disease (such as >= Grade 2 dyspnea)

DataElement.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Chronic Disease Ind-3 (2018845v1) with VD Yes No Unknown Indicator (3506034v1) - dbw
